title: Sources: Kelly officially fired by LSU without cause
content: The posturing over Brian Kelly's $54 million buyout from LSU is over, sources told ESPN, as the school sent him a letter Wednesday saying it is officially terminating him without cause.

title: Sources: Jays, Cease reach 7-year, $210M deal
content: Right-hander Dylan Cease, who has made at least 32 starts in each of the past five seasons, reached a seven-year, $210 million deal with the Blue Jays, sources told ESPN.

title: Michigan makes statement in beating Zags by 40
content: Yaxel Lendeborg said the Wolverines made a statement about their place in college basketball's hierarchy with a 40-point victory over Gonzaga in the Players Era title game Wednesday night.

title: Curry limps off with bruised quad, will have MRI
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry came up limping with a right quad contusion after a series of fourth-quarter collisions in Wednesday's loss to the Rockets and will undergo an MRI.

title: Center Ragnow ends retirement to return to Lions
content: Frank Ragnow, a four-time Pro Bowler for the Lions, is ending his five-month retirement and returning to play for Detroit.

title: Faulk expected to land Southern job, sources say
content: Former NFL star and current Colorado RBs coach Marshall Faulk is expected to become head coach at Southern University, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Celts halt Pistons' win streak at 13 in frantic finish
content: Cade Cunningham scored 42 points but missed a potential game-tying free throw in the closing seconds as the Pistons fell to the Celtics 117-114, ending their 13-game winning streak.

title: QB Smith apologizes for obscene gesture to fans
content: Geno Smith apologized for making an obscene gesture toward fans as he walked off the field following a 24-10 loss to the Browns on Sunday. It's the second time he has made such a gesture toward fans since joining Las Vegas.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Everything to know before Friday's final night of group play
content: The 2025 NBA Cup continues as group play wraps up. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament.

title: How a legendary historian is quietly fueling OKC's championship rise
content: As OKC GM Sam Presti formed a Thunder team built for a dynasty, he was inspired by a man who has been working on the same project for more than 50 years.

content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a showcase in New York City, here's what we're watching Thanksgiving week.

title: Women's Feast Week guide: Texas, South Carolina to meet for Players Era title
content: Texas, which beat No. 3 UCLA, and South Carolina meet Thursday in a game that will determine the No. 2 team in the country.

title: The Bengals' defense is the worst ... ever?!? Six wild NFL trends entering Week 13
content: Just how bad is the Cincinnati defense? How does the Giants' run D stack up since 1978? And are the Patriots and Bears legit? Let's use DVOA to find out.

content: Is King Spud lost forever? The trophy's vanishing act is one of the stranger mysteries in college sports.

content: Greg Wyshynski breaks down the biggest storylines at Survivor Series: WarGames, including John Cena's final PLE match.

content: Teams in playoff position on the holiday tend to stay there (77.1% since 2005). Who is in the best and worst shape?

content: A convincing 3-1 win over Bayern Munich has only strengthened Arsenal's case as firm favorites to win.

content: The most and least favorable matchups in the NFL for this week's games at the four key fantasy positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

content: With big games and marquee teams on the menu, Thanksgiving week is among busiest of the year for sportsbooks.

title: 'Victory Royale': 2017 Xbox One copy of Fortnite sells for $42,500
content: The sealed Xbox One copy of Fortnite received an overall grade of 10 A++, the highest grade possible.

title: Is it time for McLaren to prioritize Norris over Piastri?
content: McLaren has refused to favor one driver over the other all season, but as Max Verstappen closes in, should the Papaya outfit issue team orders?

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: Why players say league's latest proposal is 'slap in the face'
content: The Nov. 30 WNBA deadline is looming for a new CBA. The two sides continue to meet during the holiday week.

title: NFL Week 13 buzz: What we're hearing on the struggling Bucs, Pickens' next deal, fantasy football
content: Are the Buccaneers worried about their losing streak? Will the Cowboys extend George Pickens? Here's the latest intel, plus fantasy football advice.

title: Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus Thanksgiving game memories
content: Let's update our list ahead of Week 13 and pick out memories for 31 teams to play on the holiday (sorry, Jaguars).

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Haney in, Canelo out, Benavidez moves up
content: Where do Devin Haney, David Benavidez and Jesse Rodriguez land after dominant victories? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Fantasy fast break: Eric Moody on Mikal Bridges' durability, Kel'el Ware's rise and more
content: Eric Moody's fantasy basketball insights you need to know about, including Mikal Bridges' durability and production in New York, Kel'el Ware's second-year rise and more.

title: Offseason questions for every NWSL team: A way-too-early look at 2026
content: The NWSL season is over, and the planning for 2026 begins immediately. Here is one burning question for each team.

title: How San Diego went from expansion afterthought to cup contender
content: Little was expected of San Diego in its debut year, but this risk-taking young side is one step from MLS Cup.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Fernandes among 11 Man United players facing exit
content: Bruno Fernandes is one of 11 players Manchester United are willing to let go in a major squad overhaul. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Assam Passes Bill To Ban Polygamy, Makes It Criminal Offence
content: The Assam Legislative Assembly on Thursday passed a bill to ban polygamy, making it a punishable offence with up to seven years of imprisonment, along with a provision for compensation to the victim woman, Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: Pope Leo XIV Visits Turkey On First Foreign Trip Of His Papacy
content: Pope Leo XIV arrived in Turkey on his first foreign trip, fulfilling Pope Francis' plans to mark an important Christian anniversary, bring a message of peace to the region at a crucial time to end the war in Ukraine and ease Mideast tensions.

title: Amid Fear Over Voter Revision, Kolkata Sex Workers To Get Assistance Camp
content: Caught in rising fear and uncertainty over the ongoing SIR of electoral rolls, sex workers in Kolkata's Sonagachi area are likely to get a special assistance camp, as the Election Commission prepares to address their unique documentation challenges.

title: J&K Institute Raided, Devices Seized For Probe Into Suspected Unlawful Links
content: Acting on credible intelligence inputs, Handwara Police carried out a raid at the Jamia Islamia Institute in Waripora, Handwara, on Thursday as part of an investigation into suspected unlawful activities and alleged links to banned organisations.

title: Mumbai Man, 72, Loses Rs 35 Crore In Trade Fraud. He Was Unaware For 4 Years
content: Shah, who runs a low-rent guest house for cancer patients in Parel, alongside his wife, inherited a share portfolio after his father died in 1984.

title: Pakistan Judge Says Murder Of Ex-Diplomat's Daughter Result Of "Live-In"
content: Pakistani Judge, a part of the Federal Constitutional Court (FCC), Ali Baqar Najafi, opined that the Noor Mukadam murder case is the direct result of a "vice" spreading in society known as "living relationship," Dawn reported.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Storm Forms Over Bay Of Bengal, Landfall Likely On Tamil Nadu Coast
content: Mariners have been cautioned against venturing into the southwest Bay of Bengal and adjoining areas until further updates.

title: France Announces Voluntary Military Service Amid "Growing Threats"
content: French President Emmanuel Macron announced Thursday that volunteers aged 18 and 19 will start serving next year in a 10-month new military service program as France seeks to bolster its armed forces to address growing threats.

title: Imran Khan's Family Tree: Key Figures In Former Pak PM's Life
content: Tensions surrounding Pakistan's jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan have escalated after his three sisters alleged they were "brutally" assaulted outside Rawalpindi's Adiala Jail when they sought a meeting with him.

title: 'Dont Blame Ethiopian Volcanic Ash For Mumbai's Air Pollution': Court
content: The Bombay High Court on Thursday said authorities cannot blame ash clouds from the volcanic eruption in Ethiopia for air pollution in the metropolis and said the air quality index here has been poor much before that.

title: Why Hong Kong's Deadly Fire Spread Swiftly - Focus On Fast-Burning Foam
content: Three top officials of the engineering company renovating the tower complex have been arrested in a suspected case of manslaughter.

title: Andhra Minister Nara Lokesh Used Own Money For Air Travel: RTI
content: Amid his frequent air travel and criticism from opposition parties, Andhra Pradesh Minister Nara Lokesh used his own money for financing his 77 flights to Hyderabad, the Right To Information (RTI) documents showed.

title: 55 Dead After Fire Ravages 7 High-Rise Buildings In Hong Kong, 3 Arrested
content: Firefighters were still dousing a devastating fire Thursday which ripped through a Hong Kong high-rise complex, killing at least 55 people and leaving hundreds missing according to authorities.

title: Asim Munir Now Controls Pak's All 3 Defence Forces, Nukes: All About New Powers
content: Pakistan's military is entering one of its most powerful eras, and that too without directly seizing power, with army chief Asim Munir taking charge as the country's first Chief of Defence Forces (CDF) on Thursday.

title: "You Pig": Man Caught With His Pants Down Allegedly Pooping In Public
content: An Adelaide resident confronted a man squatting on a suburban street in Para Hills, reportedly to defecate. In footage shared on Facebook, Trent Carter approached the man crouching on a patch near a house.

title: PM Modi's Shoutout To Gen Z: "Creativity, Positive Attitude And Ability"
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi underscored the critical role of India's Gen-Z in reshaping the country's space sector and said that whenever India opens new opportunities, its young generation, especially Gen-Z, step forward with enthusiasm

title: 19-Year-Old Arrested  From Jammu Over Suspected Terror Links
content: A 19-year-old man has been arrested by Jammu Police for his alleged involvement in terror activities. The suspect, a resident of Reasi in Jammu, had been living in Bathindi area from where he was picked up by the police.

title: Can Scaling Laws Keep AI Improving? History Says We Cannot Be Too Sure
content: History is littered with painful reminders of scaling laws that broke. A classic example is the collapse of the Tacoma Narrows Bridge in 1940.

title: Opinion: Opinion | In Karnataka Congress Tussle, All Roads Actually Lead To Rahul Gandhi
content: The power tussle between Siddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar (DKS), a watchful Kharge, and restless regional satraps has pushed the Congress high command to its toughest test, again - to settle the power equations in Karnataka.

title: Rape Accused, Missing For A Week, Spotted At Crime Scene In Madhya Pradesh
content: The inability of the police to arrest Salman, alias Nazar, who was accused of raping a minor in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district, has sparked widespread public outrage, especially as the man has been spotted in the video in Gauharganj, the very area

title: New guidelines for gig platforms make verification, GPS tracking, and in-app SOS feature mandatory
content: Gig platforms must conduct thorough police verification and background checks of every delivery partner and driver before they start the work, says Police Commissioner Seemant Kumar Singh

title: 14-persons cyber fraud gang, including 6 based in Cambodia arrested by Bhimavaram police
content: The modus operandi of the gang was to collect mule bank accounts for transferring money into these accounts from the victims of ‘digital arrests’; Three accused based in Cambodia are from Visakhapatnam

title: India, Indonesia resolve to boost defence industrial cooperation
content: India and Indonesia also reiterated their commitment to maritime security, including coordination in the Indian Ocean

title: Netflix opposes in Delhi High Court Wankhede's plea against web series
content: IRS officer Sameer Wankhede has sought that the series, which he has alleged to be defamatory, is taken down from several websites

title: At least 65 dead as Hong Kong firefighters battle burning towers for second day
content: Rescues were continuing in some of the towers, but authorities did not provide updates on the missing or how many were still trapped inside the ravaged buildings

title: KFRI signs MoU with Odisha Bamboo Development Agency
content: The MoU marks the beginning of a long-term partnership built on scientific collaboration, knowledge sharing, and a shared vision for transforming the bamboo sector.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Coimbatore gang-rape: police get one-day custody of the three accused
content: The judge directs the police to produce the accused before the court by 4 p.m. on Friday, November 28, after interrogating them in custody

title: K-RIDE set to get full-time Managing Director after nearly three years
content: According to sources, Lakshman Singh, a 1996-batch officer from the Indian Railway Service of Engineers, is expected to be appointed as the full-time MD anytime soon.

title: Ensure quality in road construction or face action: Gadkari to contractors
content: ₹20,000 crore will be allocated for National Highways and other related projects in Gujarat by Central Government, assures Nitin Gadkari

title: Hosur airport: Tamil Nadu government on the lookout for consultant to prepare Detailed Techno-Economic Report
content: Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation (TIDCO) has now issued a Request for Proposal (RFP) to finalise a consultant.

title: See no reason to change Karnataka Chief Minister: Yathindra Siddaramaiah
content: Mr. Yathindra said he had no information of any power-sharing agreement being arrived at when the Congress won in 2023 Assembly elections.

title: Union Minister Chouhan urges farmers to follow Punjab village's successful stubble management model
content: During his arrival in Moga, Mr. Chouhan visited Ransih Kalan village to meet farmers who have stopped burning stubble for the past several years

title: Draft rules notified, but no action taken in the wake of opposition from trade unions: Minister
content: Meeting of representatives of central trade unions in the State to be held on Thursday. The Labour department will organise a national labour conclave in Thiruvananthapuram on December 19 to draw further attention to the issue

title: Malaparamba sex racket case: chargesheet filed against 12, including two police drivers
content: The suspected inter-district racket was exposed during a check at an apartment near Malaparamba in Kozhikode city in June

title: Sensex, Nifty scale record highs on rate cut hopes, foreign fund inflows
content: Sensex and Nifty scaled lifetime highs before closing marginally higher amid positive global trends on growing hopes of a U.S. Fed rate cut and foreign fund inflows

title: Elderly voters seek dignified access to ballot box
content: Many of them seek introduction of home voting option for bedridden people and special queues for senior citizens on the day of  polling

title: BJP will move no-confidence motion against Siddaramaiah government in Belagavi session: Former minister V. Sunil Kumar
content: If Congress government faced any crisis in Karnataka, the BJP will not stake claim to form the government, says former minister

title: Income Tax department identifies cases of non-disclosure of foreign assets in ITRs
content: The Income Tax department will start sending SMS and emails to such taxpayers from November 28, advising them to file a revised income tax returns by December 31, to avoid penal consequences

title: Tirupati laddu ghee-adulteration case: Former chairman Subba Reddy says he is ready for lie-detector test
content: “False leaks and fabricated narratives on the sensitive issue by leaders of the ruling parties were damaging the temple’s global reputation,” Subba Reddy said

title: Pinarayi Vijayan urges Kerala MPs to secure Presidential assent for Wildlife Bill to address human-animal conflict
content: Chairing conference of MPs ahead of Parliament’s Winter Session, CM notes that the law passed by Kerala Assembly in October envisages several provisions for expediting action against dangerous animals that injure humans and pose an immediate threat to human lives

title: Over 2 crore Aadhaar numbers deactivated in UIDAI’s clean-up
content: The Aadhaar numbers belong to deceased persons, whose details were sourced from various government departments

title: Armed forces exemplified professionalism and patriotism in guarding sovereignty, says Droupadi Murmu
content: In her address, Droupadi Murmu laid emphasis on the Army's endeavour to transform itself through quantifiable deliverables under its 'Decade of Transformation' vision

title: Red Fort blast accused Jasir Bilal Wani sent to 7-day NIA custody
content: Jasir Bilal Wani was arrested in Srinagar by the NIA on November 17 for allegedly providing technical support for carrying out terror attacks

title: Global firms keen on partnering with India in spacetech, says Prime Minister Modi
content: Inaugurating Skyroot’s Infinity Campus in Hyderabad and first orbital rocket, Vikram-I — capable of launching satellites to orbit, the Prime Minister highlighted how world has high expectations from India amid the country’s space capability being cost-effective and reliable

title: Maharashtra local body elections: Sharad Pawar raises concern about leaders alluring voters with money
content: When asked about Sharad Pawar’s comments, NCP leader Sunil Tatkare told The Hindu, “All the three alliance partners of Mahayuti have worked for the development of Maharashtra”

title: U.S. Embassy thanks CBI for busting cybercrime networks targeting its citizens
content: The CBI has arrested Vikas Kumar Nimar, allegedly behind the illegal operations of a firm — VC Infrometrix Pvt Ltd —from Lucknow last week, after being on the run for over a year

title: Woman teacher murdered in Thanjavur
content: Preliminary investigations reveal that on the night of November 26, the victim informed the accused man about her recent engagement with her cousin

title: Telangana to focus on strategy anchored in three pillars in its journey towards US $3 trillion economy
content: Human capital, productivity and investment cannot replace each other and each amplifies the rest, as per Telangana Rising 2047 Vision document

title: CPI(M) panchayat member accused of assaulting BLO in Kerala’s Kasaragod
content: The incident reportedly occurred during a camp organised at a booth for filling and submitting SIR forms

title: Illegal sex determination centre found at cattleshed in Maharashtra's Jalna; two held
content: According to police, the clandestine operation of foetal sex determination and illegal abortion had been running for several months inside the tin-shed cattle

title: Spurious liquor case: Excise police take jailed former Minister Jogi Ramesh into custody
content: The prime accused, Addepalli Janardhan Rao, in a statement given to police said he was doing the spurious liquor business with the help of the former Minister Jogi Ramesh

title: Eight-year-old dies amid suspected water contamination at Bengaluru apartment complex
content: Residents of Prestige Falcon City apartment in south Bengaluru say that health issues such as diarrhoea and vomiting have persisted among many since the start of October.

title: Delhi-NCR air pollution: Do not have a magic wand to disappear pollution, solution lies with domain experts, says Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court stresses the need for expert-led, multifaceted strategies to combat the persistent air quality crisis in the region, as it commits to ongoing hearings and comprehensive action plans

title: Rubber tapper from Jharkhand killed in wild elephant attack at Nilambur in Kerala
content: He was returning along with his co-workers after the day’s work when the elephant charged at them from behind

title: India, UAE discuss market access, data sharing, FTA progress
content: These issues were discussed during a meeting of the joint committee under India and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA)

title: 50 Sabarimala pilgrims from Tamil Nadu sustain injuries as bus overturns in Kerala’s Idukki
content: Condition of one passenger is critical, while others suffered minor injuries in the accident that took place between Kuttikkanam and Valanjakanam in Idukki. The devotees were from Dindigul

title: ‘Road to hell is paved with good intentions’: Congress slams govt over new Aravalli definition
content: Jairam Ramesh claimed that the new definition is meant to restrict mining but, in reality would mean that 90% of the Aravalli Hills would not be counted as Aravalli any more.

title: Probe under PMLA Act: ED conducts searches at 15 locations, including medical colleges
content: The locations covered during the searches include seven premises of medical colleges in multiple States and certain private persons named as accused in the CBI FIR

title: Watch: What is going wrong in Tamil Nadu’s SIR?  | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: Tamil Nadu’s Special Intensive Revision has turned chaotic, risking the deletion of lakhs of genuine voters ahead of next year’s elections. From unrealistic deadlines to confusing forms and missing instructions, the process is breaking down on the ground. In this explainer, we uncover what went wrong, what the Election Commission says, and give a step-by-step guide to protect your name on the voter list.

title: Koppal teen pregnancy case: Karnataka Child Rights Commission registers suo motu complaint
content: KSCPCR has asked the officials to submit within three days the necessary information regarding the action taken by the district administration and directions given to concerned officers.

title: Outrage in Madhya Pradesh over IAS officer’s remarks on reservation
content: Several outfits belonging to the Brahmin community protest in the State; IAS officer Santosh Verma seeks apology

title: ‘Word power is world power,’ says D.K. Shivakumar in a cryptic post on X on Karnataka leadership tussle
content: The message appears to be directed at the Chief Minister and his party bosses in New Delhi and reminding central leaders of the party on the power-sharing pact that was arrived when the party came to power back in 2023.

title: Supreme Court orders inquiry into private universities’ establishment, governance, funding, UGC monitoring
content: The court ordered the Centre, States and UGC to disclose steps taken to ensure that private universities make good their claim that they make good their promise to function on a ‘no profit, no loss’ basis

title: Sengottaiyan, former Tamil Nadu Minister expelled from AIADMK, joins Vijay’s TVK
content: Sengottaiyan is the first well-known political leader to join the TVK. He has been appointed TVK’s organisation secretary for Coimbatore, Erode, Tiruppur and the Nilgiris districts

title: Brij Sone Bagh: A sustainable luxury forest retreat in Bandhavgarh
content: Brij Sone Bagh, a sustainable forest retreat in Bandhavgarh blends luxury, local culture and ecological sensitivity with the quiet rhythm of the wild

title: Supreme Court sets up medical board at Noida hospital to explore passive euthanasia for 31-year-old
content: This is the second time in as many years that parents of the patient have approached the top court seeking passive euthanasia for their son

title: Assam Cabinet approves report on ST status for six communities
content: The report was submitted by a three-member Group of Ministers headed by Education Minister Ranoj Pegu

title: Family of late Kerala dalit activist Chitralekha faces eviction after bank issues foreclosure notice
content: Kannur Co-operative Urban Bank, controlled by Congress-led management committee, has ordered the family to vacate the house by December 7, warning that it will be seized on December 18 if the dues remain unpaid

title: Govt appoints new FRROs for Rajasthan, Assam, Chandigarh and Haryana
content: The appointment of the Foreigners Regional Registration Officers have been made under the new Immigration and Foreigners Act, 2025

title: Manipur: 3 militants arrested for 'threatening' to bomb Sangai tourism festival
content: The action came following a video posted on Facebook by a user on November 21, which contained threats to bomb the festival being held from November 21 to November 30

title: David Beckham’s visit in Visakhapatnam school highlights classroom innovation
content: The initiative is a part of a wider programme of the Mantra4Change supported by Education Above All aimed at improving classrooms across Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Odisha and Nagaland

title: Amaravati to have ‘Cosmos Planetarium’ under MoU with Indian Institute of Astrophysics
content: Officials said the upcoming planetarium will provide immense benefits to students by offering clear visual understanding of astronomy-related subjects including the universe, planets, stars and galaxies

title: ED arrests gaming platform WinZO's founder duo on money laundering charges
content: The ED had accused WinZO of "engaging in criminal activities and unscrupulous practices as customers were made to play with algorithms without being made aware of the fact that they are playing with the software and not with humans in real-money games."

title: Kerala local body polls: Parties scout among ASHAs, Haritha Karma Sena members for candidates
content: The connect of these grassroots workers with people and familiarity of the locality make them ideal choices for parties when it comes to selecting candidates

title: Kerala local body elections: High Court verdict may reflect on Munambam poll result
content: Within hours of the High Court allowing their long-standing demand for restoration of revenue rights for their holdings, six Munambam residents remitted property tax, with the remaining one set to follow suit. All three fronts have claimed credit for the development which came on the 410th day of the residents’ protest

title: Kerala local body elections: In Thiruvananthapuram Corporation polls, no party is in the driving seat
content: The LDF, in keeping with its recent trend, has fielded a number of fresh faces, seeking to continue in power, while the UDF has announced its candidates much ahead of others, hoping for a revival from its below-par performance last time. The BJP has fielded a good number of the sitting councillors compared to the two fronts, aiming to extend its good run

title: Tesla flags low maintenance and fuel costs to woo Indian buyers
content: In India, Tesla competes with homegrown rivals like Mahindra & Mahindra and Tata Motors and global players like SAIC Motor’s India unit and Vietnamese EV maker VinFast Auto

title: Supreme Court hearing on SIR updates: Where is ECI’s jurisdiction to conduct exercise en masse, asks Singhvi
content: The CJI-led Bench is hearing arguments on a larger issue of the legality and validity of the ECI's decision to revise the electoral rolls

title: Bombay HC issues notice to Maharashtra govt over Chandrapur PAPs long wait for jobs and benefits
content: 85 displaced families accuse State and Maharashtra State Power Generation Company Ltd. of ignoring statutory quota and rehabilitation norms

title: Senate poll protest: Panjab University students to ‘gherao’ BJP offices on December 3
content: The protest was initially launched against the Centre's decision to restructure Panjab University's governing bodies -- the senate and the syndicate.

title: Maharashtra CM promises 10 lakh employment opportunities for locals at Vadhavan Port
content: Speaking at an election rally, the CM Fadnavis assures locals top priority in 10 lakh jobs at Vadhavan Port, pledging rapid growth and keeping environmental balance

title: T.N. braces for intense rainfall; Bay weather system may deepen
content: Expectations run high that the wet spell could help wipe out rain deficits in districts such as Perambalur, Chengalpattu, Chennai, and Kancheepuram.

title: Building capacity for data storage top priority of MeitY: Secretary
content: Speaking at Dr. (Mrs.) YGP’s Centenary Celebrations, Mr. Krishnan said India generated 20% of the world’s data, but had the capacity to store merely 4%.

title: Punjab farmers demand fulfillment of long pending demands
content: Farmers associated with over 30 farmer and farm labour unions under the banner of Samyukt Kisan Morcha  submitted a memorandum of their demands to local authorities, addressed to the President of India

title: Rajasthan all set for storage systems in solar energy
content: Deputy Chief Minister Prem Chand Bairwa will felicitate the top 100 achievers of India’s solar sector on the second and final day of the exhibition on  November 27

title: 'Tried to incite civil war': BJP attacks Rahul, makes big claim on 'X' accounts; Cong reacts
content: The BJP has accused the Congress of using social media accounts based outside India to shape domestic political narratives. Citing X's location-tracking features, BJP MP Sambit Patra alleged that several Congress-linked handles, including those of leaders and influencers, appear to be operating from countries like the US, Ireland, and Pakistan, pushing specific narratives against the government.

title: 'Next step UCC': CM Sarma after Assam bans polygamy; who is exempted?
content: The Assam Assembly has passed the Prohibition of Polygamy Bill, 2025, banning polygamous marriages across most of the state and imposing penalties for violations. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma stated the law is not against Islam and aims to promote true Islamic practices. The bill excludes Sixth Schedule areas and Scheduled Tribes.

title: CIA link, Afghan evacuee: Details emerge of White House shooter; what triggered attack?
content: An Afghan man who worked with US forces in Afghanistan is accused of a violent attack in Washington. He had been resettled in the US after the war. This incident has led to a halt in Afghan asylum and refugee processing. The move impacts thousands of families. It also raises concerns among Afghan communities and US veterans who supported them.

title: Sundar Pichai’s space vision: Google TPUs in orbit by 2027; meet Tesla Roadster in space
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai revealed Project Suncatcher, a plan to build compact satellite data centers powered by direct solar energy. The company aims to deploy its TPUs into orbit by 2027, with Pichai humorously suggesting they might encounter the orbiting Tesla Roadster. This ambitious initiative addresses the exponential growth in future computing power demands.

title: WPL Auction 2026: Who got whom - base price, final bid and team details
content: The Women's Premier League auction kicked off with a bang as Deepti Sharma fetched a massive Rs 3.2 crore, with UP Warriorz securing her via RTM. Sophie Devine also commanded a Rs 2 crore bid from Gujarat Giants. The fourth WPL season starts January 9, with matches in Navi Mumbai and Vadodara, advanced to accommodate the T20 World Cup.

title: Another setback for Hasina: Ex-PM gets 21 yrs in jail; children face sentencing
content: A Bangladesh court has handed former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina a 21-year prison sentence in three corruption cases concerning land allocations. This verdict follows a separate death sentence for her role in last year's protests. Her son and daughter also received prison terms. Hasina, in exile in New Delhi, denies the charges, calling them politically motivated.

title: CTET February 2026 registration begins at ctet.nic.in: Check details here
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education has opened the registration window for the CTET February 2026 cycle, with applications accepted online until 18 December 2025. Candidates must complete form submission and fee payment before the deadline. The exam will be held on 8 February 2026, with Paper-II in the morning and Paper-I in the evening.

title: Future forecast: Jeff Bezos dislikes question on predictions; explains reason
content: Jeff Bezos, Amazon's founder, champions focusing on unchanging customer needs like low prices and fast delivery over predicting the future. This philosophy fuels Amazon's robust growth, with AWS revenue soaring. Now, Bezos is returning to lead Project Prometheus, a new AI venture aiming to transform manufacturing and engineering, backed by significant funding.

title: 'Third-world parenting': Nalin Haley calls Ramaswamy 'creep'; who is desi MAGA backer?
content: Nalin Haley, son of Nikki Haley, has publicly criticized Vivek Ramaswamy's childcare proposals, calling them "third world parenting style." Haley, who advocates for strict immigration policies and has faced scrutiny over his own loyalty, is increasingly vocal on the right. This online spat highlights a growing divide within conservative politics.

title: Dharmendra prayer meet: Bobby Deol looks emotional; Rekha, Sidharth Malhotra & others pay respect
content: Bollywood's beloved Dharmendra was honored with a 'Celebration of Life' on November 27th, following his passing on November 24th, 2025. Family, including Bobby and Sunny Deol, alongside industry stars like Sidharth Malhotra and Jackie Shroff, gathered at Taj Lands End. Sonu Nigam performed iconic songs, reflecting Dharmendra's joyful spirit. Hema Malini shared a heartfelt tribute, remembering his enduring legacy.

title: 11 killed in China: Train runs over rly workers; what went wrong?
content: Tragedy struck in China's Yunnan province as a test train collided with railway workers, claiming 11 lives and injuring two. The devastating incident occurred during a seismic-detection equipment test at Luoyang Town railway station. Authorities have launched an inquiry into the cause of this severe rail accident, the region's worst in over a decade.

title: 'Only one will win': Mark Cuban warns AI giants— 'overspending bubble could pop'
content: Mark Cuban has cautioned major AI firms like OpenAI and Google against excessive spending in the race for the most powerful models. He likens the current AI arms race to the 1990s search engine boom, predicting a potential bubble and winner-take-all outcome. Cuban believes true disruption will emerge from unexpected breakthroughs, not just incremental improvements.

title: Vascular surgeon shares one simple exercise for people with peripheral artery disease
content: A vascular surgeon successfully treated a young patient at risk of leg amputation due to PAD with a structured intermittent walking program. This exercise regimen, involving brisk walking intervals followed by rest, promoted collateral artery growth, significantly reducing pain and restoring mobility, ultimately avoiding amputation.

title: “It wasn’t easy”: Gisele Bündchen opens up about shock over Brady’s past
content: Supermodel Gisele Bundchen revealed the shock of discovering Tom Brady's ex was pregnant just two months into their relationship. Despite this, they married and she embraced his son, Jack. After over a decade of marriage, the couple announced their separation in October 2022, with Bundchen now a mother again and Brady reportedly single.

title: WPL auction: Full list of sold and unsold players, base price, top buys, and team details
content: The WPL mega auction kicked off with a bang as UP Warriorz secured Deepti Sharma for Rs 3.2 crore, the day's highest bid. Mumbai Indians nabbed Amelia Kerr for Rs 3 crore. Notably, Australian captain Alyssa Healy went unsold, surprising many as the auction unfolded for the 2026 WPL season.

title: Terror plot foiled: Police nab 19-yr-old Jammu teen; cops suspect Pak link
content: Jammu Police apprehended a 19-year-old for plotting a terror attack, with suspected links to Pakistan-based handlers.  Simultaneously, Kashmir Valley saw extensive raids targeting the banned Jamaat-e-Islami, aiming to dismantle terror networks.  Authorities seized electronic devices and documents during these operations.

title: Worried about your lungs amidst rising pollution? 3 ways to test them at home
content: The breath-holding test provides a fast method to evaluate your lung capacity together, with breathing control abilities. Take a deep breath before you attempt to hold your breath, for as long as you can. People with healthy lungs usually manage to hold their breath between 30 to 50 seconds. Your doctor needs to evaluate your lung capacity when you cannot hold your breath for more than 20 seconds

title: 'Social burden, not penal': SC tells Samay Raina, 3 comics to platform disabled achievers
content: The Supreme Court has directed comedian Samay Raina and three others to host shows featuring specially-abled individuals with inspiring stories. These events aim to raise funds for the treatment of persons with disabilities, with the CJI emphasizing this as a social responsibility for well-placed individuals. The directive comes amid a plea against comedians for insensitive remarks about people with disabilities.

title: Stuart Skinner struggles as Oilers teammates reportedly push for trade
content: Edmonton Oilers goaltender Stuart Skinner had a rough outing against the Dallas Stars, with defensive lapses and late line changes leaving him vulnerable. Fans of the NHL criticized the team’s effort. While captain Connor McDavid highlighted that goaltending is a team responsibility. The loss raises questions about Edmonton’s defense and Skinner’s role moving forward.

title: Tua Tagovailoa sings 'Thinking out loud,' brings Thanksgiving cheer at Florida hospital
content: Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa and his wife Annah visited Joe DiMaggio Children’s Hospital, bringing Thanksgiving cheer to young patients. The couple engaged in games, packed caregiver kits, signed autographs, and even performed a song, demonstrating their commitment to the Tua Foundation's mission of spreading joy and support to families during difficult times.

title: '27th floor, room 1 — he is dead': Eyewitnesses recall Hong Kong fire; what sparked the tragedy?
content: A devastating fire ripped through Hong Kong's Wang Fuk Court complex, claiming over 50 lives and leaving hundreds injured or missing. Residents described harrowing escapes as flames engulfed their homes. Suspected to be fueled by combustible bamboo scaffolding used for repairs, the blaze spread rapidly, prompting a massive rescue effort and leaving many homeless.

title: Blake Lively Avoids Taylor Swift ‘Smear Campaign’ as Travis Kelce Stays Silent
content: Hollywood's once-tight Blake Lively-Taylor Swift friendship appears strained, with Lively's recent social media silence fueling speculation. This distance is reportedly linked to Lively's legal battle with co-star Justin Baldoni, which inadvertently involved Swift. Insiders suggest Swift is working to rebuild trust, indicating a complex, human dynamic behind the public perception of a feud.

title: WPL auction: Australian star Alyssa Healy goes unsold
content: The 2026 Women's Premier League mega-auction commenced with a surprising unsold bid for Australian captain Alyssa Healy, who was hampered by recent calf and past finger injuries.  The auction features a wide age range of players, with franchises aiming to fill 73 slots, including 23 for overseas talent.

title: What happens to the human body before freezing to death explained
content: Extreme cold triggers a silent shutdown of the body. Initially, shivering and numbness give way to confusion and weakness as core temperature drops. The body's systems, including the brain and heart, progressively fail. This leads to a deceptive sense of peace before death, underscoring the critical need to recognize early hypothermia signs and act swiftly to prevent fatal outcomes.

title: Map dispute: Nepal's new Rs 100 notes features Indian territories; revives 2020 row
content: Nepal's central bank has released new Rs 100 notes featuring a revised national map that includes disputed territories claimed by India. This move reignites a long-standing border dispute, with India previously condemning Nepal's 2020 map update as an unacceptable "artificial enlargement" of claims.

title: 'My lungs have adapted, it's fine': Vir Das quips on Mumbai's deteriorating air
content: Mumbai's air quality has significantly deteriorated, with several areas entering the 'very poor' category. Actor Vir Das highlighted the issue in a viral video, comparing the internal air quality to the smoggy exterior. Local activities, traffic, and wind patterns are cited as reasons for the varying pollution levels across the city.

title: 'Sorry': Rishabh Pant posts emotional message after 0-2 drubbing against South Africa
content: India's Test team suffered a significant defeat, losing 0-2 to South Africa in their home series. Vice-captain Rishabh Pant, leading in Shubman Gill's absence, apologized to fans for the team's performance. This series marked South Africa's first Test series victory in India in 25 years, extending India's poor home record.

title: White House shooting: US suspends immigration requests of Afghans
content: Two National Guard soldiers were critically wounded in a daylight shooting near the White House by an Afghan national with US military ties. The suspect, Rahmanullah Lakanwal, was apprehended after a firefight. President Trump labeled the incident an "act of terror," leading to a halt in Afghan refugee processing and sparking debate on immigration policies.

title: Twin basketball tragedies rock Haryana: 2 teens die after rusted poles collapse
content: Two teenage basketball players, Hardik Rathi and Aman, tragically died in separate incidents in Haryana after basketball hoop poles collapsed on them. These horrific accidents have exposed serious flaws in the state's sports infrastructure and governance, leading to the suspension of a district sports officer and calls for urgent reforms.

title: Watch: Camera dipped into Japanese drain stuns viewers
content: A viral video by UK travel blogger Alicia Cooper reveals the stunning clarity of Japan's gutters, showcasing colorful koi fish swimming in a drainage canal in Shimabara.  These canals, fed by natural springs and populated with koi since the 1970s to attract tourists, have impressed viewers with their cleanliness and vibrant aquatic life.

title: AI reunites lost Pakistani woman with family: How she returned home after 17 years
content: A young Pakistani woman, missing for 17 years, has been reunited with her family thanks to facial recognition technology and AI. Kiran, who went missing at age 10, was identified through a 2008 missing-person report. She expressed gratitude to the Edhi Foundation, where she grew up, before returning to her parents.

title: It's Thanksgiving! Los Angeles freeways get buried in traffic — video goes viral
content: Thanksgiving travel chaos grips Los Angeles as the 405 Freeway transforms into a sea of red brake lights. Millions nationwide are hitting the roads, making this one of the busiest holiday travel periods in decades. Viral footage captures the extensive gridlock, with drivers facing standstill traffic long before reaching their destinations.

title: Samyuktha Shanmuganathan ties knot with Anirudha Srikkanth; first photos break the internet
content: Actress Samyuktha Shanmuganathan has married Anirudha Srikkanth. The wedding took place today in Chennai. This marks a new beginning for both Samyuktha and Anirudha, who were previously divorced. Their union has garnered significant attention online. Fans are sending warm wishes to the couple as they embark on their married life together.

title: ‘Very Amerdican’: Vivek Ramaswamy shares lighthearted moment ahead of Thanksgiving
content: Vivek Ramaswamy playfully responded to a jibe about his "American cosplay" on X, a lighthearted moment amidst ongoing xenophobic attacks he faces.  Born to Indian immigrants, Ramaswamy, a Republican hopeful, has been a target of racist remarks, even on family photos. His rise highlights the growing Indian-American presence in Ohio politics.

title: 'Engineers, designers, coders, scientists': PM Modi gives shoutout to Gen Z — watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded India's Gen Z for their significant contributions to the burgeoning private space sector. He highlighted their innovative work in propulsion systems, composite materials, and satellite platforms, noting that over 300 space startups are shaping India's future in space. This praise comes amidst political discussions involving youth engagement and electoral integrity.

title: 'A challenging time’: Jemimah Rodrigues withdraws from WBBL; will support Smriti Mandhana
content: India's Women's World Cup hero Jemimah Rodrigues has withdrawn from the remainder of the WBBL season to support teammate Smriti Mandhana. Mandhana's wedding was postponed due to her father's health issue, prompting Rodrigues to stay in India. The Brisbane Heat franchise fully supported her decision, wishing the family well during this challenging time.

title: 'Imran Khan is fully healthy': Pakistan jail rubbishes health rumours
content: Adiala Jail administration has dismissed rumors of former PM Imran Khan's transfer or ill health, confirming he is well and receiving medical attention. This clarification follows unverified social media claims and an alleged assault on his sisters during a protest over his restricted visits.

title: Exclusive: Raashii gets candid about meeting Rekha after 120 Bahadur
content: Raashii Khanna reflects on the profound impact of '120 Bahadur', a war drama that deeply moved her. A highlight was meeting Rekha, who praised the film's emotional honesty and Raashii's portrayal of resilience. Preparing for the role involved connecting with the soldier's family, transforming the character into a profound responsibility and one of her most challenging yet grounding experiences.

title: India's shock home defeat: 'Coach can't pick up bat and play' - Ashwin defends Gambhir
content: R Ashwin defended head coach Gautam Gambhir following India's Test series loss to South Africa, cautioning against a rush to blame. Ashwin emphasised that players must also take responsibility for performances, stating that individual attacks on the coach are unwarranted. He highlighted that managing a team is complex and mistakes are inevitable.

title: Stock market hit fresh lifetime highs: What’s driving the rally & is it sustainable? Explained
content: Stock market at record high! Nifty50 has crossed 26,300 and Sensex has gone past 86,000 for the first time. There is renewed optimism about the Indian stock markets - but is the current rally sustainable? Here's what experts have to say:

title: ‘Felt unwell during walk’: CJI Surya Kant echoes Delhi health concerns
content: Supreme Court considered shifting to virtual hearings due to severe Delhi air pollution, with the CJI expressing personal discomfort. The court also took strong exception to the Delhi government's absence in a PIL seeking internet facilities for EWS students during pollution-induced school closures. The Education Secretary was summoned, and authorities were directed to file responses.

title: 'They are killing white people': Trump bars South Africa from G20 in Miami
content: America's President Donald Trump has barred South Africa from the 2026 G20 Summit in Miami. He cited human rights concerns and alleged mistreatment of white communities.  South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa called the move regrettable and based on misinformation.  The nation reaffirms its commitment to the G20 and equal participation for all members. This action deepens diplomatic strains between Washington and Pretoria.

title: Watch: Man dumps garbage into sea; his reply on being confronted sparks outcry
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. title: Scalpel losing edge: Few medical graduates opt for surgery
content: Representative image Anuja Jaiswal is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India, with an impressive 18-year career in narrative journalism. She specializes in health and heritage reporting, expertly simplifying complex health information to make it engaging and understandable for readers. Her deep dives into heritage topics are well-researched, resulting in captivating narratives that resonate with her audience. Over the years, she has worked in Chandigarh, Chhattisgarh and West UP, gaining diverse on-ground experience that shapes her storytelling. Read More

title: CFP Bubble Watch after Tuesday's ranking: Who needs a win during Rivalry Week?
content: the ACC's hope of having two teams qualify for the 12-team field is still alive . five ACC teams are still ranked above no. 24 Tulane, the only representative from a group of 5 conference . a gap remains in spite of the head-to-head win .

title: MLB offseason grades: AL champs land an ace as Blue Jays sign Cease
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, we'll weigh in with what it all means for next season and beyond .

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks
content: Matt Bowen breaks down his fantasy expectations for Rashee Rice in week 13 . this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS .

title: Previewing the Thanksgiving three-pack: Picks, predictions, fantasy X factors
content: the average over/under point total of 51.2 is the highest for Thanksgiving games over the past 40 seasons . ESPN Research provides optimistic stats for all six teams, along with betting nuggets to know . three analysts give us final score picks for the three games .

title: 🏈 CFB Bottom 10: The 'Lane Train' hits the buffers
content: Paul Finebaum explains why it feels like Lane Kiffin will be picking a new job instead of staying at Ole miss . Rusty: "you think we need one more." "Ocean's Eleven" reminds you of Thanksgiving dinner and the laughs shared around the table .

title: Week 14 Anger Index: Why BYU, Notre Dame and others should be mad
content: Ohio State stays atop the latest CFP rankings, with Indiana, Texas A&M, Georgia and Texas Tech all remaining in their same spots in the top five . a botched extra point at the end of Notre Dame-Texas a&M still hinges on the college football playoff rankings . the canes had a 90% chance of winning, according to ESPN's metrics .

title: Grades for all 32 NHL teams a quarter way through the season
content: the 2025-26 season has reached its quarter mark, with all 32 teams having played more than 20 games . a first-quarter letter grade for all 32 clubs is through the games of Nov. 23 . they lead the NHL in goals per game while also giving up the fewest goals .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Raptors, Pistons battle for top of East standings
content: we're about one month into the 2025-26 NBA regular season and coming to the end of group play for the third-annual NBA Cup this week . the Detroit Pistons continue to be dominant through the first couple of weeks of play, climbing to the top of the Eastern Conference and 2.5 games ahead of the Toronto Raptors . our insiders break down this week's NBA power rankings .
